intro: Sphaerostephanos porphyricola, commonly known as the purple-flowered stephanos, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive spherical inflorescence, which gives it its genus name. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically purple or pink in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Sphaerostephanos porphyricola is native to specific regions in southern Africa and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
